Source file src/github.com/haraldrudell/parl/parlca/parlca.go

Documentation: github.com/haraldrudell/parl/parlca 

     1  /*

     4  */
     5  
     6  /*
     7  Package parlca provides a self-signed certificate authority
     8  
     9  © 2020–present Harald Rudell <harald.rudell@gmail.com> (https://haraldrudell.github.io/haraldrudell/)
    10  */
    11  package parlca
    12  
    13  import (
    14  	"crypto"
    15  	"crypto/x509"
    16  	"io"
    17  )
    18  
    19  type Certificate interface {
    20  	DER() (der CertificateDER)
    21  }
    22  
    23  type CertificateDER []byte
    24  type KeyDER []byte
    25  
    26  // PrivateKey does not contain public part of a key pair, only the private key
    27  type PrivateKey interface {
    28  	HasKey() (hasKey bool) // has key material
    29  	Algo() (algo x509.PublicKeyAlgorithm)
    30  	PrivateBytes() (bytes []byte) // untyped private key material
    31  }
    32  
    33  // KeyPair implements crypto.Signer and can therefore be used as tls.Certificate.PrivateKey
    34  type KeyPair interface {
    35  	PrivateKey
    36  	Bytes() (bytes KeyDER, err error) // untyped key material, both private and public keys
    37  	PublicBytes() (bytes []byte)      // untyped public key material
    38  	Private() (signer crypto.Signer)  // typed key material implementing crypto.Signer for x509.CreateCertificate and tls.Certificate.PrivateKey
    39  }
    40  
    41  type CertificateAuthority interface {
    42  	Check() (isValid bool, cert *x509.Certificate, err error) // gets x509.Certificate version
    43  	DER() (bytes CertificateDER)                              // untyped bytes, der: Distinguished Encoding Rules binary format
    44  	Sign(template *x509.Certificate, publicKey crypto.PublicKey) (certDER CertificateDER, err error)
    45  	SetReader(reader io.Reader)
    46  }
    47  
    48  type KeyGenerator func(io.Reader) (keyPair KeyPair, err error) // creates private key, returns public key
    49  

Build version go1.17.8.
